name: Fish Curry
history: Fish Curry is a staple dish in coastal regions of India, reflecting the diverse cooking styles across different states. It's known for its rich, tangy, and spicy flavor profile, often influenced by local ingredients and regional preferences.
description: Fish Curry is a flavorful and spicy dish made with fish fillets cooked in a tangy and aromatic sauce. The curry is typically made with a base of onions, tomatoes, and a variety of spices, and is often enriched with coconut milk or cream.

instructions.title: Prepare the Fish
instructions.description: Clean and cut the fish fillets into medium-sized pieces. Marinate with a pinch of turmeric and salt for about 15 minutes.

instructions.title: Cook Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and curry leaves. Once they splutter, add onions and sautÃ© until golden. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and green chilies.

instructions.title: Add Tomatoes and Dry Spices
instructions.description: Add pureed tomatoes to the pan. Cook until oil separates. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and tamarind paste. Cook for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Simmer the Fish
instructions.description: Add the fish pieces to the pan. Pour in coconut milk or cream (if using) and enough water to cover the fish. Simmer on low heat until the fish is cooked and the curry thickens.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander. Serve hot with rice or naan.

tips: Choose firm-fleshed fish that holds well in curries.
Adjust the amount of tamarind and spices according to your taste.
variations: Add vegetables like bell peppers or eggplant for extra nutrition.
For a spicier curry, increase the amount of green chilies and red chili powder.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish.
Garnish with a lemon wedge or fresh herbs for added freshness.
